snippet: Patricia Dresch, who lost her husband and one of her daughters during Hurricane Sandy, is the first homeowner to be bought out under New York City’s recovery program.
abstract: Patricia Dresch, who lost her husband and one of her daughters when Hurricane Sandy floodwaters tore through their Tottenville, Staten Island home, is first homeowner to be bought out under New York City’s recovery program; in giving homeowners pre-storm market value of their homes, city hopes to reduce the number of properties in flood-prone areas.
lead_paragraph: Patricia Dresch, who lost her husband and one of her daughters during Hurricane Sandy, is the first homeowner to be bought out under New York City’s recovery program.

headline.main: After Tragic Loss During Hurricane Sandy, a Woman Chooses Not to Return
headline.print_headline: After a Tragic Loss, Choosing Not to Return
